item.title: Chinese podcast recommendations
item.author: xiangaoole@gmail.com (Harold Gao)
item.description:
Podcast (PODCAST) is a form of audio programs similar to radio stations in ancient early days. Its production cost is lower than video content and higher than text content. Compared to reading text, it is much easier to listen to the podcasts. Compared with watching videos, it is easy for a podcast to get more in -depth and detailed insights.

For me, the place where the podcast is most attractive to me is to accompany and nourish, just like sitting among a group of people, listening to them chatting, you can feel everyone’s voice and laughter through the sound, and feel the atmosphere of the conversation at the time. It is important that you can find a lot of interesting people through a favorite podcast and open a lot of interesting worlds.

From listening to the monthly radio program updated by Miss F in 15 years in Netease Cloud Music, to listening to “Proud Form” on Himalayas, and then using a special podcast to use a “small universe” to listen to a large number of podcasts, I listen to the history of the podcast It has been more than 8 years. item.title: Digital nomads in "just work, not work"
item.author: xiangaoole@gmail.com (Harold Gao)
item.description:
“[Now young people, why don’t you want to go to work] (https://www.douban.com/note/655911213/)"? In February 2018, after watching the first episode of “The Round Table” “I don’t want to go to work”, Lin An -an office worker who made digital media marketing wrote this text in Douban.

She continued to interview a few friends who did not go to work after get off work, and began the interview project “100 people who did not go to work.” Through the popularity of this topic, Lin An got a lot of media, magazines, and opportunities for business cooperation, which gave her to feed her confidence through writing. At the same time, in order to prevent the instability of text work in early income, she tried to turn her photography hobby into a living method for paying for a contract. Finally, in the summer of 2018, she resigned. For the second month of resignation, her monthly income exceeded the work salary for the first time.

In a blink of an eye, Lin An has entered the 6th year of the freelance profession. By exploring, transforming, and light entrepreneurship, she is now doing the “Liberal Living Room” of a free professional community and has her own entrepreneurial team.

The book “Only Working, No Work” was published in September 2019. It includes the story of 20 people who do not go to work in “100 people who do not go to work”, and of course Lin An’s own story. In this article, I will share the stories of several partners of the digital nomads.

item.title: A guide to living in Dali
item.author: xiangaoole@gmail.com (Harold Gao)
item.description:
Cangshan Erhai Lake is beautiful, but the place where Dali is most attractive is actually its precious community atmosphere. If you want to understand what this community atmosphere is in advance, you may wish to read the book “Dali Interview: as if there is a light”.

My longing for Dali was influenced by [Jade’s Podcast “Evening Wind”] (https://www.podchaser.com/podcasts/1054935/episodes/e50jade-60754923). In early 2020, the epidemic was finally promoted to travel from Beijing to Dali, and started a series of podcast programs interviewed by Dali Life. In those days, I struggled in Shenzhen, and often listened to these podcasts in the evening of the weekend, running along the seaside, and at those gentle nights, the other life choices presented in the show gradually moved me. In the end, at the end of 2020, I also came to Dali and lived for 2 months.

This is not a travel notes, nor will it cover many Dali Internet celebrity punch points. It is a fragment that I like very much in slow travel. It constitutes Dali I yearn for. In two months, in addition to 3 days in Shaxi Ancient Town and Jianchuan Ancient Town in Jianchuan County, I went to Jizi Mountain in Binchuan County to climb the mountain in one day. Surrounding activities.
